Flux¶

The flux module contains data structures for holding the flux variables used in DISORT.

class flux.IncidentFlux(beam_flux: float = 3.141592653589793, isotropic_flux: float = 0.0)¶

Create a data structure for holding the incident fluxes.

IncidentFlux creates scalars for the incident beam and isotropic fluxes and performs checks that the input fluxes are valid inputs to DISORT.

property beam_flux¶

Get the input flux of the incident beam at the top boundary.

Returns

The beam flux.

Return type

float

Notes

In DISORT, this variable is named “FBEAM”.

property isotropic_flux¶

Get the input flux of isotropic sources at the top boundary.

Returns

The isotropic flux.

Return type

float

Notes

In DISORT, this variable is named “FISOT”.

class flux.ThermalEmission(thermal_emission: bool = False, bottom_temperature: float = 0.0, top_temperature: float = 0.0, top_emissivity: float = 1.0)¶

Create a data structure for holding thermal emission variables.

ThermalEmission creates variables needs to include thermal emission in DISORT.

property bottom_temperature¶

Get the input temperature at the bottom boundary.

Returns

The bottom boundary temperature.

Return type

float

Notes

In DISORT, this variable is named “BTEMP”.

property thermal_emission¶

Get whether thermal emission will be used in the model.

Returns

True if thermal emission is requested; False otherwise.

Return type

bool

Notes

In DISORT, this variable is named “PLANK”.

property top_emissivity¶

Get the input emissivity at the top boundary.

Returns

The top boundary emissivity.

Return type

float

Notes

In DISORT, this variable is named “TEMIS”.

property top_temperature¶

Get the input temperature at the top boundary.

Returns

The top boundary temperature.

Return type

float

Notes

In DISORT, this variable is named “TTEMP”.
